author: LightyGab

text:
Actually, I think Zestiria has a share of problems. The story sadly has lots of plot holes. 
But what makes it better... is playing Berseria! Really! It is the prequel to Zestiria and you are getting soooo much explained in that. So I would rec to play through Zestiria and then get Berseria and play through this.
Also, the music in Zestiria is really good.

author: JFK piano

text: The Stream of the Blue Ocean will surely take us towards our Destiny Fulfilment ~ Melodic Cries of the Crashing Waves (Part III)
author: Sbeast

text:
the contribution of go shiina to this game got me really hooked up when i played and the first of his soundtracks came up
it's picking up a pace that's different(faster) from what you hear throughout most parts of the game and thus gives you a feeling of more action going on
however i find it sad that many people seem to dislike motoi sakuraba's songs especially with tracks like "The Sparrowfeathers" and all the towns' themes
it's the first title of the Tales-Series i played and 60 hours in i don't regret buying it
can't wait for my copy of Symphonia when it hits steam
author: Konstamonsta

text: The problem with Go Shiina, imo, is that his music sounds too artificial.

text: i think this was actually my least favorite of the elemental temples' ost, but it's still fantastic nonetheless

text: +i'm elli yeah: I'd have gone for wind of the four, but really there's no wrong choice.
author: tallwhiteninja

text: Holidays are over, back to reality! At the same time, with all the family and friends gatherings + the huge amount of ingested food, I don't feel too bad going back to the usual routine. I'm almost done compiling my final Top 10 GOTY 2015 list, but it's especially hard to order my top 4... It should be posted next week. Zestiria is a 2015 game I haven't got the chance/time to play, but having listened to the soundtrack I'm sure glad to see Go Shiina being back to contribute a couple quality tracks like this one (he composed the Tales of Legendia OST).
author: SupraDarky

text:
+SupraDarky While Motoi Sakuraba will always be my favourite because of what he did for Symphonia and Vesperia, Go Shiina's tracks for Zestiria are by far the stars of the soundtrack.

Wasn't too bad of a game either, a little lacking compared to previous titles, but nothing wrong with it.
author: Gouzaku Fuwachi

text: +SupraDarky Go Shiina is absolutely fantastic!
author: XCAltoona

text: +SupraDarky Tales of Legendia had some awesome music. my fav was The Bird Chirps, I Sing
author: VictorVonFox

text: Yeah, Go Shiina's tracks definitely shine in this game. I've sorely missed them since Legendia.
